newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - July 2.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - July 2.

text.p: -- Nike Inc said its fiscal fourth quarter profits rose 17 percent from a year earlier. It said this reflected a slowdown in growth that the sports footwear and apparel maker forecast more than a month ago. The results were at the low end of a prediction Nike issued on May 29. The stock closed at 58-13/16 on Tuesday. Dealers said Nike traded at 58 after the bell.

-- Pennzoil Co said it rejected a hostile, $84-per-share cash and stock takeover offer from Union Pacific Resources Group Inc. Union Pacific said it believed a merger was "inevitable." Pennzoil's stock last traded at 75-5/8. Union Pacific Resources closed at 25.

-- Cornerstone Imaging Inc said it expected to break even in the second quarter. The First Call consensus estimate is $0.11 per share. A year ago the company lost $0.05 per share. The stock closed at 7-5/8.

-- IKOS Systems Inc said it expected third quarter operating income of $2 million, or $0.22 per share, excluding estimated charges of about $7 million. The First Call consensus estimate is $0.29 per share. IKOS closed at 20-3/8.
